title: Tesla misses estimates for third-quarter deliveries on stiff competition
description: Growing consumer interest in hybrids over EVs, a lack of European subsidies and strong competition in China were a drag on Tesla's deliveries, as Chinese automakers such as BYD and Xpeng aggressively expand their presence in the world's largest automotive market, with help from local government subsidies.
content: Tesla handed over fewer vehicles than analysts expected in the third quarter as stiff competition in China and Europe hit demand for its aging models, putting the electric-vehicle maker at risk of its first-ever decline in annual deliveries.
cleaned_content: tesla handed over fewer vehicles than analysts expected in the third quarter as stiff competition in china and europe hit demand for its aging models putting the electric vehicle maker at risk of its first ever decline in annual deliveries
